page.title: 08PLACE NAMES
page.content: Horsley means 'a clearing for horses'.Horsley played an important part in the development of the Nonconformist movement in the north of England.John Wesley regularly visited Horsely from 1743 onwards and preached in a house at the west end of the village. The name of Ovingham is Saxon and probably means 'homestead of the sons of Offa'. Thomas Bewick,the famous engraver,was educated in Ovingham and is buried in the churchyard of St. Mary the Virgin. Wylam means the village with a 'wile'.This old-English word represented something wily,either a trick or a mechanical contrivance such as a watermill or fish trap.
